dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, I'm just reading this here, uh, 52,000 satellites? They're planning *52,000* of these things?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, I'm just reading this here, uh, fifty two thousand satellites? They're planning fifty two thousand of these things?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Starlinks service is still nascentit only went into public beta over the summer with nearly 900 satellitesbut the company has ambitious plans to put 42,000 satellites into orbit for widespread high-speed internet access.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, well, to get, like, internet to everyone, right? Rural areas, they desperately need this, man.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, well, to get, like, internet to everyone, right? Rural areas, they desperately need this, man.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Lack of internet access, especially in rural areas, has become of increasing concern during the pandemic. At a time when work and school activities are being held online, only 77% of the population in rural areas of the U.S. have access to high-speed broadband internet, according to 2018 data from the FCC.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Desperately need... and we're just handing them, what, $885 million? For something that's, like, still in beta?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Desperately need... and we're just handing them, what, eight hundred eighty five dollars million? For something that's, like, still in beta?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Elon Musks SpaceX won $885.5 million in subsidies from the Federal Communications Commission Monday to provide rural areas with high-speed internet through its Starlink satellite project... Starlinks service is still nascentit only went into public beta over the summer with nearly 900 satellites

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It's an investment, though! Look, 77% of rural America, they don't even have access to high-speed broadband. This is huge.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's an investment, though! Look, seventy seven percent of rural America, they don't even have access to high-speed broadband. This is huge.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: only 77% of the population in rural areas of the U.S. have access to high-speed broadband internet, according to 2018 data from the FCC.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: An investment in Elon Musk's pockets, probably. And uh, $500 million for *free Wi-Fi hotspots*? Ten hours a week? That's not a solution, that's a gimmick.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: An investment in Elon Musk's pockets, probably. And uh, five hundred dollars million for free Wi-Fi hotspots? Ten hours a week? That's not a solution, that's a gimmick.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: A gimmick? No, it's, um, it's bridging the digital divide! They're hitting 35 states, 642,000 locations. That's real impact.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A gimmick? No, it's, um, it's bridging the digital divide! They're hitting thirty five states, six hundred forty two thousand locations. That's real impact.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The FCC says the money will allow SpaceXs Starlink project to reach 35 states across 642,925 locations, while the only other satellite company to win subsidies in the auction, Maryland-based Hughes Network Systems, won $1.3 million serving 3,678 locations in one state.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Real impact, or just, like, creating a monopoly? Hughes got $1.3 million for one state, and SpaceX gets almost a *billion*.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Real impact, or just, like, creating a monopoly? Hughes got one point three dollars million for one state, and SpaceX gets almost a billion.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Elon Musks SpaceX won $885.5 million in subsidies... the only other satellite company to win subsidies in the auction, Maryland-based Hughes Network Systems, won $1.3 million serving 3,678 locations in one state.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Because SpaceX is actually innovating! They're the only satellite operator in the top four bidders, they're doing something different.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Because SpaceX is actually innovating! They're the only satellite operator in the top four bidders, they're doing something different.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: SpaceX was the only satellite operator among the top four bidders by dollar amount, behind LTD Broadband, Charter Communications and Rural Electric Cooperative Consortium.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Different, sure. But, uh, an assured source of revenue, as the analyst says. This is just the government becoming their anchor customer.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Different, sure. But, uh, an assured source of revenue, as the analyst says. This is just the government becoming their anchor customer.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This is great for SpaceX because now they have an anchor customer, Quilty Analytics senior analyst Caleb Henry told CNBC. Up until this point SpaceX has not announced any major customers ... and [this auction] provides them an assured source of revenue that they can build on as long as they meet the FCCs criteria.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So what if they're an anchor customer? It gets the project off the ground, it helps millions of people. It's smart business.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So what if they're an anchor customer? It gets the project off the ground, it helps millions of people. It's smart business.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Smart business for *them*. What happens when Starlink goes belly up? Or, like, they don't meet their profit targets?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Smart business for them. What happens when Starlink goes belly up? Or, like, they don't meet their profit targets?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: They're projecting profitability by late 2023! With 5 million subscribers. They're not just, um, playing around here.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They're projecting profitability by late twenty twenty three! With five million subscribers. They're not just, um, playing around here.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Five million? When they only went into public beta *this summer*? That's, uh, that's ambitious, to say the least.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Five million? When they only went into public beta this summer? That's, uh, that's ambitious, to say the least.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Starlinks service is still nascentit only went into public beta over the summer with nearly 900 satellites

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That's exactly what we need! Ambitious tech solving real problems, instead of, like, waiting around for... uh... traditional companies.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's exactly what we need! Ambitious tech solving real problems, instead of, like, waiting around for... uh... traditional companies.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Traditional companies that actually, um, have a proven track record. Not just promises about 52,000 satellites darkening our skies.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Traditional companies that actually, um, have a proven track record. Not just promises about fifty two thousand satellites darkening our skies.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: the company has ambitious plans to put 42,000 satellites into orbit for widespread high-speed internet access.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Darkening our skies? Come on, man. It's high-speed internet. For *everyone*. This is good for the country!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Darkening our skies? Come on, man. It's high-speed internet. For everyone. This is good for the country!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Good for the country, or good for one very specific, very wealthy, uh, guy named Elon Musk?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Good for the country, or good for one very specific, very wealthy, uh, guy named Elon Musk?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It's both! It can be both, you know?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's both! It can be both, you know?
